benchmark_details.name: Benchmark of Expert-edited Machine-generated Outputs (Beemo)
benchmark_details.overview: Beemo includes 19.6k texts, composed of 6.5k human-written texts and 13.1k machine-generated & LLM-edited texts, designed for evaluating machine-generated text detection in various scenarios.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive benchmark for evaluating the detection of machine-generated texts, particularly those that have been edited by experts or LLMs.

data.source: The dataset comprises texts collected and edited from a variety of instruction-finetuned LLMs and human-written content as prompts.
data.annotation: Expert annotators edited the machine-generated texts based on guidelines for accuracy, coherence, and fluency.

methodology.calculation: AUROC scores are calculated based on the probability that a detector assigns higher scores to a randomly selected machine-generated text than to a randomly selected human-written text.
methodology.interpretation: Higher AUROC values indicate better performance of the machine-generated text detectors.
methodology.validation: The benchmark has been evaluated using 33 different configurations of MGT detectors.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The dataset does not contain identifiable personal information and uses anonymized expert responses.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Materials are released under MIT and CC-BY-NC-4.0 licenses, depending on the source.
